cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 345 miles W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn north-northwest tonight and then north-northeast on Wednesday, tracking toward the Florida Big Bend, crossing the peninsula and moving offshore into the Atlantic toward the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast between Anclote River and Indian Pass

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch Anclote River to Indian Pass; Tropical Storm Watch west of Indian Pass to Walton/Bay County line (all on Gulf coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect at this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast Big Bend, then Atlantic coasts from northern Florida through the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: 20–35 kt gusts possible Thursday night into Friday with a 25 % chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side around Port Canaveral; main surge threat confined to Florida Gulf coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches of rain possible across east-central Florida including Port Canaveral, with locally higher amounts, leading to flooding/ponding in low-lying areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and periods of reduced visibility for vessel operations beginning late Thursday
